page.title: 01MAUCHLINE N.E. RURAL AREA
page.content: This area is an agricultural one with a strong emphasis on dairy farming. Ayreshire dairy cows, for which the district is famous, predominate with a small percentage of Galloway beef cattle. The beautifully kept farms of the area are worthy of a special note, as are the several small bridges constructed from locally quarried stone. The greater part of the land is arable. the main crops being hay, silage and barley; the land being enclosed by high hedges, much in need of attention and an occasional lightly wooded area can be seen. There are only three roads of any magnitude, the A76 Machline - Kilmarnock road, a small section of the B7037 Galston - Sorn road and the B744 Crossland - Galston road, all the res being single track roads (some of which are in need of repair) for mainly agricultural
